{{cpp/io/basic_filebuf/title |is_open}}
{{cpp/io/basic_filebuf/navbar}}
{{ddcl |
bool is_open() const;
}}

Returns {{c|true}} if the most recent call to {{lc|open()}} succeeded and there has been no call to {{lc|close()}} since then.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
{{c|true}} if the associated file is open, {{c|false}} otherwise.

===Notes===
This function is typically called by {{lc|std::basic_fstream::is_open()}}.

===Example===
{{example
 |
 | code=
#include &lt;fstream&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::ifstream fs("test.txt");
    std::filebuf fb;
    fb.open("test.txt", std::ios_base::in);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha
              &lt;&lt; "direct call: " &lt;&lt; fb.is_open() &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "through streambuf: " &lt;&lt; fs.rdbuf()-&gt;is_open() &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "through fstream: " &lt;&lt; fs.is_open() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
 | output=
direct call: true
through streambuf: true
through fstream: true
}}
